page.title: 06Transport
page.content: The M2 MOTORWAY cuts through the S.W. corner of our block.It takes traffic,from the N.of the province to Belfast and to the M1 for the S.of the province.This road link was the reason for the siting of PLASTERMIX/ROADMIX (see p.10).It carries COMMUTER traffic as well as COMMERCIAL traffic from our area,feeding in at SANDYKNOWE. From this roundabout runs the Antrim Line and a short motorway to the Larne Line.The Manse Rd.runs up the valley, to the minor roads on the plain. ULSTERBUS (blue buses) travel on the main roads.CITYBUS (red buses) serves New Mossley.There is no PUBLIC TRANSPORT in the Ballycraigy area. The RAILWAY from York Rd. Belfast, to Londonderry runs through our block. It is used only to move stock and for 'The Portrush Flyer',on excursions.
